fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.mimetype

Interface ReplaceMimetypeBuilder<P>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the parent builder (when calling Parent.and() method)
    All Superinterfaces:
    Builder<MimetypeReplacer>, Parent<P>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ReplaceMimetypeBuilderDelegate, SimpleReplaceMimetypeBuilder

    public interface ReplaceMimetypeBuilder<P>
extends Parent<P>, Builder<MimetypeReplacer>
    Configures mimetype replacement. This may be needed in some situations where the detected mimetype is accurate and valid but it may be understood by external systems that are less accurate. A concrete example is detection of XHTML mimetype. Standard detection will detect that mimetype is "application/xhtml" or even "application/xhtml+xml". This is the expected result from the point of view of mimetype detection. However, in the context of an email client, "application/xhtml+xml" may be unknown. The resulting email will then be unreadable. This is where replacement is useful. You can then degrade the standard behavior and replace "application/xhtml" and "application/xhtml+xml" by "text/html".
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • pattern

        ReplaceMimetypeBuilder<P> pattern(String matchingPattern,
                                  String replacement)
        Eventually replaces a mimetype if it matches the provided regular expression. The regular expression may contain groups. Matching groups can be used in replacement string. For example: 
         
 replacer = builder
   .pattern("application/xhtml[^;]*(;.*)?", "text/html$1")
   .build();
   
 newMimetype = replacer.replace("application/xhtml+xml;charset=UTF-8");
 System.out.println(newMimetype);
 // prints "text/html;charset=UTF-8"
        Parameters:
        matchingPattern - the regular expression as string, no regular expression flag is applied
        replacement - the replacement (can contains regular expression replacements too)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • pattern

        ReplaceMimetypeBuilder<P> pattern(Pattern matchingPattern,
                                  String replacement)
        Eventually replaces a mimetype if it matches the provided regular expression. The regular expression may contain groups. Matching groups can be used in replacement string. For example: 
         
 replacer = builder
   .pattern(Pattern.compile("application/xhtml[^;]*(;.*)?"), "text/html$1")
   .build();
 
 newMimetype = replacer.replace("application/xhtml+xml;charset=UTF-8");
 System.out.println(newMimetype);
 // prints "text/html;charset=UTF-8"
        Parameters:
        matchingPattern - the regular expression
        replacement - the replacement (can contains regular expression replacements too)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • contains

        ReplaceMimetypeBuilder<P> contains(String contains,
                                   String replacement)
        Eventually replaces a mimetype if it contains the provided string. The matching is case insensitive. 
         
 replacer = builder
   .contains("application/xhtml", "text/html$1")
   .build();
   
 newMimetype = replacer.replace("application/xhtml+xml;charset=UTF-8");
 System.out.println(newMimetype);
 // prints "text/html"
        Parameters:
        contains - the string to match
        replacement - the replacement
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • contains

        ReplaceMimetypeBuilder<P> contains(String contains,
                                   boolean ignoreCase,
                                   String replacement)
        Eventually replaces a mimetype if it contains the provided string. The matching is case sensitive if ignoreCase is false and case insensitive if ignoreCase is true. 
         
 replacer = builder
   .contains("application/xhtml", "text/html$1")
   .build();
   
 newMimetype = replacer.replace("application/xhtml+xml;charset=UTF-8");
 System.out.println(newMimetype);
 // prints "text/html"
        Parameters:
        contains - the string to match
        ignoreCase - true to ignore case (case insensitive), false to respect case (case sensitive)
        replacement - the replacement
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use
